title: Director, Enterprise Sales (Nordics)
description:
Our Director, Enterprise Sales will provide strategy, mentorship, and guidance for a team of Enterprise Sales Executives who are responsible for driving new business through the full sales cycle.
   

  

*At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.*
**What You’ll Do:**
* Manage, hire, train and ramp a team of Enterprise Sales Executives responsible for new and expansion bookings
* Achieve annual Enterprise bookings quota with monthly and quarterly targets
* Develop and manage Enterprise Sales Executives on productivity metrics such as deal size, win rate, and forecast accuracy as well as how to lead a customer through a proactive sales cycle
* Coach Sales Executives through building executive relationships with Named Enterprise accounts in their territories and through complex Enterprise deals and negotiations
* Shape the direction of the go-to market strategy and execution for your region
* Work collaboratively with Marketing, Product and Success to build targeted messaging and collateral, and mapping a customer journey for the specific business needs of your region
* Conduct weekly forecast meetings
* Support direct reports by participating and leading in client and prospect meetings. Engaging other corporate resources as required


**Who You Are:**
* Experienced in managing a high performing Enterprise Sales team for a B2B technology company
* A strong relationship builder with 5+ years of overall Enterprise sales experience working with Fortune 1000 companies
* Confident in managing complex sales processes with multiple stakeholders and negotiations with pricing based on business value, legal and procurement
* Knowledgeable in selling to C-level executives in the IT space
* Experienced in setting quotas and managing people against those quotas
* Passionate about coaching others with a successful track record as an individual contributor and can share relevant and complex closing experience with a growing team
* Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites
* Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 70% of the time


*Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.*
**Benefits and Growth:**
* High income earning opportunities based on self performance
* New hire stock equity (RSU) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)
* Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing
* Sales training in MEDDIC and Command of the Message
* Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking
* An inclusive company culture, opportunity to join our Community Guilds
* Generous and competitive medical benefits package
* Retirement savings match
* Pet adoption and insurance program


*Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.*
**About Datadog:**
 Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity at Datadog:**
 Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.
   

  

**Your Privacy:**
 Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Teknisk förvaltare inriktning fysisk säkerhet
description:
Det är på regeringens uppdrag som Statens fastighetsverk (SFV) förvaltar vårt gemensamma natur- och kulturarv. Vi förvaltar en mångfald av statligt ägda fastigheter – däribland regeringsbyggnader, domstolar, slott och kungsgårdar, teatrar, museer, ambassader samt en sjundedel av landets yta bestående av skog och mark.
   

  

 Som medarbetare är vi stolta över att vara anställda på en myndighet, arbeta utifrån den statliga värdegrunden och få bidra till en positiv samhällsutveckling.
   

  

 Vi förstärker vår förvaltningsorganisation inom fastighetsområde Regeringsbyggnader. Vi söker därför en teknisk förvaltare med inriktning fysisk säkerhet som vill vara med och driva och utveckla den fysiska säkerheten inom dessa unika och för Sverige viktiga kvarter.
   

  

 Du kommer ingå i ett härligt team bestående av en projektsamordnare, nio tekniska förvaltar varav tre arbetar med fysisk säkerhet som tillsammans verkar för att uppfylla vårt mycket viktiga uppdrag. Välkommen till fastighetsområde Regeringsbyggnader!
   

  

**Din roll** 
  

  

 I rollen som teknisk förvaltare med inriktning fysisk säkerhet arbetar du strategiskt och operativt med verksamhetsskydd och säkerhetsskydd. Det innebär att du har ansvar och förståelse för fortifikation och skyddsteknik, perimeter samt områdesskydd.
   

  

 I ditt ansvar ingår bland annat att ta fram kravställning och samordna krav inom fysisk säkerhet, både internt i förvaltning, i byggprojekt och med externa parter.
   

  

 Du är rådgivande i frågor kring fysisk säkerhet, genomför utbildningsinsatser och utvecklar metoder inom området. Du genomför även interna kontroller hos oss.
   

  

 Du arbetar med byggnader med stora kulturhistoriska värden, vilket kräver en noggrann och varsam hantering för att bevaras inför framtiden. Du jobbar i en spännande miljö tillsammans med andra tekniska förvaltare och vår driftorganisation.
   

  

 En viktig del i din roll är att bearbeta funktionskrav till kravställning i byggprojekt, läsa och förstå konstruktionsritningar och teknisk dokumentation samt kunna förmedla krav i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Din profil** 
  

  

 Vi söker dig som har högskoleutbildning med inriktning byggteknik och konstruktion samt flera års erfarenhet av byggteknik, konstruktion inom fastighetsförvaltning eller byggprojekt. Alternativt har du minst fyra års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av kvalificerat arbete inom fysisk säkerhet.
   

  

 Meriterande är:
   

  

* Certifieringar eller utbildningar inom området fysisk säkerhet eller andra dokumenterade specialistutbildningar
* Kunskap om svensk standard SS-EN 1522, SS-EN 1063, SS-EN 13123
* Kunskap om skydd mot RÖS
* Kunskap om skydd mot farliga ämnen
* Erfarenhet av konstruktion och kravställning perimeterskydd i byggprocessen
* Erfarenhet av projekt i säkerhetsskyddad verksamhet
* Erfarenhet om ballistik- och tryckvågsskydd
* Erfarenhet av kontroll, uppföljning och utvärderingar av fysisk säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom statlig myndighet eller större organisation med säkerhetsskydd/säkerhetsfrågor


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Som person är du driven, strukturerad och har ett helhetsperspektiv. Du trivs med att lära dig och utvecklas inom nya områden. Du delar gärna med dig av din kunskap och erfarenhet. Tjänsten innebär många olika kontakter och samarbeten både internt och externt så god samarbetsförmåga är viktigt.
   

  

**Mer information** 
  

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning och SFV tillämpar 6 mån provanställning.
   

  

 För frågor är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Mathias Thelin tfn 010-478 72 85.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter för Saco, Seko och OFR/S nås via vår växel, 010-478 70 00. Mer information om SFV hittar du på  www.sfv.se .
   

  

 Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kan en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) komma att genomföras. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och i vissa fall krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Statens fastighetsverk verkar inom branscher som är exponerade mot olika risker för oegentligheter, i förbyggande syfte förekommer därför tjänster där lämplighetsprövning genomförs.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-02-16 och vi ser fram emot din ansökan och CV.
   

  

 Välkommen till oss!

title: Enterprise Architect - Tietoevry Corporate Business Services
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
**Enterprise Architect - Tietoevry Corporate Business Services**
 Do you have a strong background in Enterprise Architecture, passion for problem-solving, and want to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!
   

  

 We are looking for an Enterprise Architect who would be part of our CIO Team in Tietoevry Corporate Business Services (CBS). Tietoevry CBS’ focus is to bring together core capabilities to enable and accelerate business performance. We play a vital part in the implementation of Tietoevry´s strategy and supporting the distinct success paths of our end-to-end businesses, through delivering high-quality services at scale and fostering an exceptional culture.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry CBS as an Enterprise Architect** 
  

  

 You join a skilled team at the CIO Office, where you learn new things with your colleagues.  You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including architectural teams in Businesses, to support overall company objectives.
   

  

 This role is critical for Tietoevry in ensuring that the enterprise’s IT infrastructure and technology support its strategic business needs effectively, efficiently, and securely. Also it is key role to participate in designing and overseeing the overall structure and architecture of a future landscape of IT systems, aligning them with business goals and objectives.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

**Developing Enterprise Architecture Framework:**
* Create and maintain a comprehensive enterprise architecture framework to ensure consistency and integration across the organization’s IT systems and business processes.
* Utilize industry-standard frameworks such as TOGAF (The Open Group Architecture Framework) or Zachman Framework.


**Strategic Planning and Alignment:**
* Collaborate with senior leadership to align the IT strategy with the organization’s business strategy.
* Develop long-term IT strategies to ensure scalability, flexibility, and alignment with business growth and transformation.


**Technology Assessment and Selection:**
* Evaluate and recommend emerging technologies that could improve the organization’s operational effectiveness.
* Assess new IT tools, systems, and platforms to support business needs.


**Governance and Compliance:**
* Establish and enforce architectural governance, ensuring that IT projects adhere to the enterprise architecture framework.
* Ensure compliance with security, regulatory, and industry standards.


**Designing Architecture Models:**
* Design and document architectural models, blueprints, and diagrams to represent the IT infrastructure, systems, and processes.
* Create roadmaps for evolving the architecture in line with future business and technology changes.


**Collaboration and Stakeholder Management:**
* Work closely with other IT teams (such as development, operations, and security) to ensure the architecture meets technical, security, and business needs.
* Liaise with business leaders to understand requirements and ensure IT investments and solutions align with strategic business objectives.


**Risk Management:**
* Identify and mitigate risks related to IT architecture, data management, and system integration.
* Ensure disaster recovery, business continuity, and other risk management protocols are incorporated into architecture design.


**Project Management Support:**
* Provide guidance and support to IT project teams, ensuring that new solutions fit within the architecture and adhere to defined standards.
* Oversee architecture reviews for major IT projects, ensuring compliance with design principles.


**Continuous Improvement:**
* Continuously assess the performance and effectiveness of existing systems and processes.
* Drive innovation and process improvements to enhance the organization’s technological capabilities.


 Skills and Qualifications:
   

  

* Technical Expertise: In-depth knowledge of IT infrastructure, software development, cloud platforms, security, and data management.
* Architectural Methodologies: Familiarity with architectural frameworks such as TOGAF, Zachman, or similar.
* Strategic Thinking: Ability to align IT systems and infrastructure with business strategies and long-term goals.
* Communication Skills: Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Problem Solving: Ability to analyse complex systems, identify challenges, and propose effective solutions.
* Leadership: Experience leading cross-functional teams and managing relationships with various business units and stakeholders.
* Certifications (optional but advantageous): TOGAF, Azure Solutions/Power Platform Expert, or similar certifications in enterprise architecture.


 Education and Experience:
   

  

* A Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related fields.
* Several years of experience in IT roles, with a proven track record in architecture, systems design, or enterprise architecture.
* Experience in leading enterprise-wide transformation initiatives and technology integrations is preferred.


**We Offer**
 We offer you a broad range of professional experiences, meaningful projects and collaborations within CBS and Tietoevry. You will have the opportunity to be part of creating the future of the growing and fast-developing tech sector. We have an open culture and outstanding work-life balance, offering you responsibility and flexibility from the start. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.
   

  

  

  

**Did we get you inspired?** 
  

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV and cover letter and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact hiring manager jyri.peltoniemi@tietoevry.com.
   

  

  

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

  

  

*We perform background checks on all final candidates.* 

  

  

*Tietoevry declines calls from recruitment companies.* 
  

  

**About Tietoevry** 
  

  

 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.
   

  

  

  

 Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprises and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs. Familiar yourself with what we do
   

  

  

  

  

  

 Creating purposeful technology to reinvent the world for good
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Systemintegratör verifiering
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Drivs du av att se dina idéer bli verklighet? Välkommen till vår spännande och teknikintensiva värld.
   

  

 Din roll
   

  

 Inom Surface and Aircraft Systems arbetar vi med komplexa system som används på plattformar som stridsflygplan och stridsfartyg. Som Systemintegratör kommer du att testa hela EW-system med stort fokus på mjukvara, där du deltar i förberedelser, utförande, dokumentation och analys av våra systemtester. Automatisering och utveckling för att förbättra vår miljö är en naturlig del av din roll, och du kommer även att utvärdera resultat från simuleringar för att säkerställa att hård- och mjukvara möter kundens förväntningar. Ibland innebär det att du, tillsammans med en utvecklingskollega, samarbetar för att upptäcka och lösa eventuella problem som uppstår i systemet.
   

  

 Du kommer att bli en del av ett sammansvetsat team på omkring 15 personer, som nu expanderar för att möta den ökande efterfrågan. Vår grupp är välkomnande och vi värdesätter samarbete, positivitet och ödmjukhet.
   

  

 Resor förekommer i rollen, och kan i vissa fall även innebära något längre perioder av arbete på plats hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Din profil
   

  

 För att lyckas i den här rollen behöver du utöver en praktisk hårdvaru- och mjukvaruförmåga även ha en förmåga att strukturera, dokumentera och planera ditt arbete. Trivas med att gifta ihop hårdvara med mjukvara. Vi hoppas att du har, likasom vi, har en positiv inställning och ett intresse att skapa goda samarbeten. Om du trivs med att utforska tekniska områden, ta itu med utmaningar inom världsledande teknik, då är du rätt person för oss. Vi ser även gärna att du har ett analytiskt och kvalitetsinriktat tänk genom ditt arbete.
   

  

 Vi söker dig med:
   

  

* Civil- eller Högskoleingenjörsexamen
* 3 års erfarenhet i rollen som Systemintegratör och/eller som Nätverksspecialist
* Arbetat med verifiering och har vana att skapa verifieringsrapporter
* Resa i tjänsten, både inrikes och utrikes.
* Goda kunskaper i både det svenska och engelska språket, såväl tal som skrift
* Kännedom om Försvarsindustrin (meriterande)


*Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.*
 Vad du blir en del av
   

  

 Bakom våra innovationer finns alla de som har gjort det möjligt. Modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare. Vardagshjältar och kreativa problemlösare. De som delar djup kunskap och de som utforskar nya områden. Och alla däremellan.
   

  

 Här har du chansen att påverka och bidra på ditt unika sätt. Allt från att utveckla kod och bygga imponerande försvars- och säkerhetslösningar till att ta en kaffe med en kollega. Varje bidrag räknas. Vi ger dig möjlighet att anta utmaningar och skapa smarta innovationer. I vår vänliga och tekniksmarta värld finns plats för dig att växa. Vi finns här för att tillsammans skapa trygghet för människor och samhällen.
   

  

 Saab är ett ledande försvars- och säkerhetsföretag med uppdrag att hjälpa nationer att skydda sin befolkning och bidrar till trygghet för människor och samhällen. Med 24 000 talangfulla medarbetare utvecklar Saab teknik och lösningar för en säkrare och mer hållbar värld.
   

  

 Saab utvecklar, tillverkar och underhåller avancerade system inom flygteknik, vapen, ledningssystem, sensorer och undervattenssystem. Saab har sitt huvudkontor i Sverige men en global verksamhet där Saab är en del av många nationers försvarsförmåga. Läs mer om oss här
   

  

 Om du är intresserad av vilka förmåner som du kan ta del av som anställd på Saab i Sverige, kan du läsa om dem här
   

  

 Vänligen observera att vi arbetar med löpande urval och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum har gått ut.

title: Senior System Design Engineer, Traction Voltage, Electromobility
description:
Do you want to be at the forefront of developing electric vehicles and sustainable transportation?  

Volvo Group Electromobility is changing the automotive world, and we are now looking for you who want to contribute to a sustainable transformation through innovation. The Electromobility organization is responsible for the complete lifecycle development of our electric powertrains – from advanced engineering through product development into the maintenance phase. Together we drive Electromobility transition based on cutting-edge engineering and state-of-the-art research. By joining us, you’ll be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals. We make our customers; the planet and our future generations win.  

Do you want to use your embedded software engineering skills to develop real tangible solutions that will change the way we live and work? **If so, apply today!**  

  

**The position**  

The role of the Senior System Design Engineer is to work with system changes and new features to our electric driveline. You will be responsible for defining requirements and working with the traction voltage system to develop solutions for meeting those requirements. For many software developers, this represents an exciting next step in their career.  

  

In the technology shift into electromobility, this is a cross functional position that is bridging the software and hardware requirements. You will balance the complexity of third part integration with the customers applications in combination with challenges connected to heavy vehicles and platform design. In addition, you will drive cross functional work including system concept and risk analysis. Your collaboration and communication skills are therefore very important.  

  

**Who are we and what do we do**  

The Traction Voltage System Group is a diverse group with skilled Senior System Design Engineers. We work in an innovative area, where we contribute early to the projects. We are part of an inclusive environment with a rapid pace of technology innovations- for faster charging times, increased transport range and a platform mindset that are cost effective.

 **Who we are looking for**  

We are looking for someone with a Master of Science in Electronics, Data science, Software engineering, Mechatronics or similar. Ideally you have 6-8 years’ experience working with embedded software design and development or embedded system design and development. Extended experience with propulsion systems in battery electric vehicles and experience from traction voltage systems/components is also valued. It is an advantage to have documented experience working with functional safety and it is meritorious if you have worked with Cyber security in automotive products and applications.

  

As a person, you should have a solid technical leadership experience in cross functional environment, be a good communicator, be effective at planning and prioritising tasks, be results oriented and willing to challenge the current norms. You are fluent in both written and verbal English.  

You can take decisions, engage and inspire, have confidence in your abilities to influence outcomes, are structured and creative, and passionate about networking across functions to achieve shared objectives.  

  

**What we can offer**  

We are offering you an exciting opportunity to work with completely new technology and help develop full-electric propulsion systems for a range of different vehicles and machinery. The Volvo Group has high ambitions when it comes to sustainability and CO2 emissions. By playing such an important role in the company’s electromobility development, you will be a key contributor to achieving those targets.  

  

As a large, global company, we can also offer multiple career paths for further growth and development. This can either be more senior roles within the same technical area, expansion into new technical areas or switching to management roles.  

  

For more information, contact Johan Ramert, johan.ramert@volvo.com

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group.** Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Project Engineer
description:
**Join us and contribute to the world’s transition to a green and sustainable future!**


Would you like to make an impact on the green transformation of society? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where each day offers new challenges and opportunities? If you're passionate about working with cutting-edge technology and would enjoy collaborating with a team of skilled engineers, then please read on!

**NKT in Karlskrona**


At our state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Lyckeby (Karlskrona) NKT produces high voltage and extra high voltage power transmission cables for both on- and offshore applications. Home to our cable-laying vessel, Viktoria our facility also boasts one the most advanced AC & DC High Voltage cable testing labs in Northern Europe.

**Your Role as a Project Engineer**


As a Project Engineer at NKT, you'll be at the forefront of helping us deliver advanced cable systems.


Your responsibilities will include:

* Driving technical aspects of the project.
* Designing high-quality, cost-effective cable systems in adherence to customer specifications and industry standards.
* Conducting technical calculations encompassing electrical, thermal, and mechanical aspects.
* Managing cost calculations for products, testing, and engineering work.
* Assessing risks and opportunities in delivery projects.
* Serving as a technical interface to customers in delivery projects.
* Crafting technical documents outlining the proposed solutions for customers.

**Qualifications**


To excel in this role, you should have:

* A Bachelor's degree in a technical field, such as electrical engineering, physics, mathematics, or chemistry.
* Proficiency using modern 3D modeling software applications, such as Matlab and Comsol.
* Fluency in Swedish and English (spoken and written).
* Experience in a related technical field would be advantageous.

**What We Value**


At NKT, we foster innovation and collaboration, encourage the sharing of ideas across our organization and value working with colleagues from diverse backgrounds.


Key attributes we seek include:

* High technical interest and competence.
* Active participation in personal and collective development.
* Systematic and analytical problem-solving skills.
* Independence and a strong sense of responsibility.
* Efficient time management and flexibility in project work.
* Strong teamwork and communication skills.

**How to Apply**


If you’re ready for a rewarding career in a fast-growing, high-tech environment, please apply on our website.


Due to GDPR regulations, we also cannot accept applications via email.


For any questions regarding the position or the recruiting process, you are welcome to contact our recruiter cajsa carlsson at cajsa.carlsson@nkt.com.

**Union representatives**  

Swedish Engineers: Christian Fisch, +46 455 56 380


The Union: Joakim Wikström +46 73 407 0243  

The leaders: Roger Jönsson, +46 455 55 911

**We look forward to your application!**

**About NKT**  

*At NKT, we are all Connectors. We connect to develop leading technologies that enable the world’s transition to renewable energy - and we stay connected to grow as people and professionals. As a company, NKT connects a greener world with high-quality power cable technology and takes centre stage as the world moves towards green energy. NKT designs, manufactures and installs low-, medium- and high-voltage power cable solutions enabling sustainable energy transmission. NKT is headquartered in Denmark and employs 5.000 people. NKT is listed on Nasdaq Copenhagen and realised a revenue of EUR 2.6 billion in 2023. We connect a greener world.* *www.nkt.com*
company_addresses:
HQ Denmark: Vibeholms Allé 20, 2605 Brøndby     

Germany: Düsseldorfer Straße 400, Im Chempark, 51061 Köln
company_description: Do you want to play a leading role in the green transition? Do you want to enable to continued electrification of society? Then join us on our journey and become an NKT Connector.

title: Manufacturing Engineer
description:
**Can you engineer a brighter tomorrow?**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

It’s crystal clear: the actions we take in the next few years will significantly impact our future. At Volvo Cars, we embrace change. We’re committed to transforming the automotive industry and leading in electrification. For this, we’re seeking out more creative minds to shape that future. Don’t miss this opportunity to create your tomorrow.

  


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------

  

At Volvo cars, Manufacturing Engineering Propulsion Components (MEPC), you will be part of a global team that makes sure that the EDU/Inverters and HV batteries meet the highest expectations from our customers. In close collaboration with colleagues in other business units, we develop and implement flexible and efficient products, methods and processes with people in focus. If you want to reach your personal goals together with other people, Manufacturing Engineering is the place for you to prosper.  

We offer you an exciting challenge in an international and growing company with a strong culture and great development opportunities. You will have the opportunity and responsibility to actively contribute to the growth of our business through people.

  


Manufacturing Engineering Propulsion Components at Volvo Cars prepares and implements quality assured flexible and effective production systems in our plants globally. You are part of a group working close to all our elements within the chain of developing- construction- manufacturing and containing process.


MEPC Commodity are owner of product, method and process over time, by developing, defining and preparing each system during the whole life cycle. This means we are responsible for verification of assembly solutions, both virtual and physical, and we will always strive for commonality within all our plants.


**What you'll do**
------------------

  

We are seeking Global Commodity Manufacturing Engineers to join our newly established launch teams for EDU/Inverter and HV Battery. These positions require travel to our plants during industrialization and launch phases. As a Global CME, you will:


* Contribute to FMEA and risk assessment activities.
* Be responsible for product and method verification.
* Ensure manufacturing requirements are met.
* Provide R&D feedback through your Central CME colleagues.
* Drive the VPC process within your area.
* Implement product changes in relevant plants.
* Master product and process to manage product changes and their consequences effectively.
**What you'll bring**
---------------------

  

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering or equivalent experience.
* Knowledge of 6 Sigma and Lean Production.
* Proficient in using Teamcenter software.
* Experience in production processes and product development, preferably in the automotive industry.
* Geometrical knowledge and experience in automation assembly are advantageous.


Your personality is of utmost importance to us. We value commitment, positivity, and proactiveness, and we believe these traits will help you thrive in this role. The ideal candidate is analytical, target-oriented, and open-minded, with excellent communication skills.


**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
--------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Anastasiia Maidanyk at anastasiia.maidanyk@volvocars.com. For specific questions about the position, please reach out to our Hiring Managers Anna Burman at ANNA.BURMAN@VOLVOCARS.COM and Rickard Pedersen at rickard.pedersen@volvocars.com.

  

  

Once your application is successfully submitted, you’ll receive a confirmation email. Applications are open until 3rd of February 2025. We’re excited to get to know you!

  

  

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
**Our Philosophy & Story**

We’re not your typical tech startup. Our technical co-founder learned to code using GPT as a pair programmer in 2022 and has since built full-stack applications for businesses worldwide. This unconventional journey reflects how we work and think about growth.

We believe great software comes from creative problem-solving and innovative approaches, not just following traditional playbooks. Using the right tools, mindset, and determination, we’ve built solutions that compete with teams much larger than ours.

What does this mean for you? We’re looking for a builder – someone who thrives on finding creative solutions and working independently, while embracing collaboration and innovation. If you’re a proactive problem-solver who enjoys building scalable software, we want to hear from you.

**The Opportunity**

We’re seeking a talented **Senior Full-Stack Engineer** to join our founding team and help shape the future of our platform. As our first technical hire, you’ll work closely with the technical founder, mentor future team members, and play a key role in turning our MVP into a robust, enterprise-grade solution.

**What You’ll Do**:

* Co-lead the technical evolution of our AI-powered platform.
* Shape architecture and make key technical decisions.
* Develop innovative features from concept to production.
* Collaborate directly with founders and future team members.
* Scale our platform to meet the needs of enterprise clients.

**Our Current Tech Stack**:

* **Next.js** & **TypeScript**
* **React** (component-based architecture)
* **Supabase** (data backbone)
* Various **AI services**

**What We’re Looking For**:

* 3–5+ years of full-stack engineering experience.
* Strong proficiency in **TypeScript** and **React**.
* Experience integrating **AI/ML services**.
* Background in B2B SaaS product development.
* Knowledge of **enterprise security practices**.
* Expertise with **Next.js** and modern React patterns.
* Skills in building scalable applications.

*Preferred*: Located within CET ±2 hours to facilitate async collaboration.

**What Makes You Stand Out**:

* Startup experience.
* Knowledge of **Supabase/PostgreSQL**.
* Regular use of AI in your workflow.

**What We Offer**:

* Competitive contract rate equivalent to **€50–80k/year**, depending on skill and experience, with potential for **full-time employment** and additional benefits as we grow.
* Flexible remote work setup.
* Equity participation opportunities (details discussed during the interview).
* Unlimited PTO (minimum required to ensure proper rest).
* Ground-floor opportunity at a fast-growing startup.
* Budget for learning and development.
* Direct impact on product decisions.
* Potential conversion to full-time employment as the company grows.

**Our Values**:

* We prioritize user experience.
* We experiment and learn fast.
* We believe in open communication.
* We move quickly but thoughtfully.
* We maintain work-life balance.

**Interview Process**:

We value your time and keep our process straightforward:

1. Initial chat with the technical founder.

2. Technical deep-dive (real-world problems, no algorithm puzzles).

3. Team fit conversation.

4. Final discussion and offer.

**Next Steps**:

Interested? Send us:

1. Your experience with our tech stack.

2. What excites you about our mission.

3. Your timezone and preferred working hours.

4. Details about a project you’re proud of (code or otherwise).

5. Your earliest start date.

6. A resume

**Impact Potential**:

Joining us now means shaping the technical foundation of a platform used by enterprise clients. You’ll work on cutting-edge AI technology, help grow the development team, and play a crucial role in our journey from MVP to scale.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: 48 000,00kr - 77 000,00kr per month

Work Location: Remote

title: DU Head 1 (Client Specific)
description:
Stockholm
Sweden
**Job Family**


Business Management (Business Mgmnt)
**No. of Positions**


2
**Job Description (Posting).**

Audio Quality Test Engineer: will provide services to improve, develop and maintain the test systems, e.g. modify and develop test software for adequate testing of the newly developed audio processing algorithms.The work includesValidation of audio processing components including, but not limited to acoustic echo cancellation, automatic gain control, beamforming, and noise reduction, as well as the complete audio processing stack across multiple different laptop and mobile platforms as required by Google.Vendor will need to develop new and modify existing validation tests, test vectors, test scripts and test setup configurations for validation purposes across the different platforms (1.) To create and review the Test Cases from the Functional Specifications or Software Requirement Specification document. (2.) To test the Functionality as per the Test plan and respective Test Cases.. title: Maps Services Lead Engineer
description:
**Summary**  

  

Posted: Dec 20, 2024
  

  

Weekly Hours: **37.5**
  

  

Role Number:**200583487**  

  

Are you a self-starter looking for an exciting career opportunity? Do you like to ship software solutions that impact Apple Maps users around the world? Are you passionate about leading complex software engineering work? A job at Apple is unlike any other you’ve had. You’ll be challenged, inspired, and you will be proud of your work. Maps are a significant part of our everyday lives. Whether you are selecting a fine restaurant for dinner with friends, finding public transit that gets you to the big game before kickoff, or looking for the nearest gas station, you are relying on services provided by the Maps Services Team. The Apple Maps Services team develop cutting-edge guidance products to constantly improve the navigation experience and help hundreds of millions of people every day with their driving, walking and public transit needs. The team is also responsible for generating the vector maps that powers the beautiful map display in Apple Maps. We are looking for a skilled lead software engineer, with a passion to take ownership of problems and deliverables, lead software engineering work, and to organise skilled engineers to deliver the next generation of display and navigation services for Apple Maps.
  

  

**Description**  

  

- Lead and drive the work of a team of remarkably skilled software engineers. - Be a strong advocate for the customer experience. - Take ownership of solving problems and deliver solutions on time. -Communicate and coordinate with teams and stakeholders in the US. - Participating in design and code reviews. - Influencing the future product direction.
  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

* Ability to take ownership, identify requirements, prioritise and make progress in an environment with limited given input.
* Very strong in leading others, and hands-on, in programming, system design and problem solving.
* Extensive, professional experience from software engineering.
* Fluent communication in English with a sense for listening to others as well as getting your message through in a crisp way.
* Experience in cross team collaboration and communication across multiple timezones.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Strong understanding of common data structures and basic graph algorithms.
* Mindset of writing efficient code, recognising that the "optimal solution" may not always be the most efficient if its impact is minimal.
* Experience in Scala, Python, Kotlin, and C++.
* Knowledge in Spark, Iceberg and spatial algorithms/problems.
* Experience from working in distributed engineering teams.
* Knowledge from the maps (GIS) domain, related to routing, navigation, traffic or display maps.
* Experience from the ML domain.

Adequate understanding of the physics behind the Dynamic Thermal Modelling methods and some experience on validation methods

title: HIL Engineer
description:
* **Heroes do not grow on trees; they grow in Noor Engineering**

**Noor Engineering**


Noor engineering aims to provide clients with highly professional technical consultants. Our consultants are experts in their fields. Employees at Noor Engineering are proud of their employer.

**Vision:**


Noor Engineering helps individuals and organizations to achieve success

**Strategy:**


We target excellence in everything we do. We are brave to work creatively with innovative solutions. We work with instant improvements and prioritize learning. We don’t compete with low prices; we compete with maximizing added value.

**Our Services**


Our consultants have experience in world-class in the Automotive and Railway industries. We offer consultants in Testing, Test management, Software development, Project Management, and Agile coaching.


Today’s software development and testing environments are complex and challenging. Short delivery time scales, complex products to test, and demanding customers. These challenges demand well-thought-out project management practices and development and test way of working and smart test management practices.


One of the most important key success factors in any project is people skills. We offer solutions to strengthen people skills in testing, project management, SCRUM, and agile testing.

	+

**Requirements:**

Discover impactful work as our new Field Service Engineer (FSE). As an FSE, you will be responsible for delivering service activities including Installations, Repairs and Maintenance Services for the Bulk Elemental Analysis team in EMEA. * Responsible for providing services both remote or at site, within the agreed conditions.
* Service reporting, documentation and creation of protocols to specification both internally and for customer needs.
* Maintain a high level of customer allegiance by building strong customer relationships and promoting an excellent customer experience.

* Excellent career progression opportunities with a large and growing global employer.
* High quality training and mentoring
* Competitive salary, plus performance bonus & full benefits package

title: Radio Network Systems Engineer Physical Layer Algorithms
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

At 5G/6G Baseband System Management our main task is to specify the wanted behavior of advanced radio network functions for the 5G NR RAN. We also engage in 3GPP standardization, develop and use simulators to optimize signal processing algorithms, develop baseband architectures, collect and analyze data from customer networks and perform troubleshooting.

  

We are looking for a Radio Network Systems Engineer that will join our excellent team and work with the signal processing, radio communication, development of 5G-software simulations, supporting the deployment of our new 5G products, and much, much more!

 **What you will do:**

  

* Perform systems studies in the area of Radio Physical Layer for radio functions like Beam Forming, Massive MIMO, 6G etc.
* Specify new 5G/6G system features and functions, including requirements, test cases, algorithms, use cases, parameter settings and address any interactions with legacy features and functionality
* Develop software simulations for the performance analysis of 5G features and algorithms, primarily link-level
* Contribute to advances of 5G/6G Standards. Update our Statement of Compliance to relevant standards
* Contribute to Innovation and Ericsson IPR. File Invention disclosures and Patents
* Support the deployment of new 5G/6G products and features into customer networks. Work with Customer troubleshooting and analysis. Understand customer configurations and issues.
* Work collaboratively on new features, simulations and improvements with cross-functional development teams situated locally as well as worldwide

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Strong background in communications theory and digital signal processing and mathematics
* Strong knowledge of LTE & NR 3GPP specifications, especially in the areas of the Physical Layer
* Experience in SW development for Link simulations. Languages include Python, C and C++
* Experience in the software development and analysis of simulations (knowledge of simulation environments and tools like MATLAB would be an asset)
* Analytical mindset and result orientation to deliver even when under pressure
* Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines and manage many different projects at once
* Excellent English skills, both verbal and written, providing effective communication building positive relationships internally as well as externally
* High level of motivation, as well as being a self-starter or a team player as needed
* M. Sc. or Ph.D. degree in a relevant area, preferably with demonstrated experience and knowledge in the above-mentioned required skills areas
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
**🚀 Senior Full-Stack Engineer -** 
 Synca
 



  





 Contract-to-Hire Opportunity | Remote (CET ±2 hours)
 



  





**🎯 Big News!** 




  





 We just raised funds from one of Scandinavia's largest consulting groups, Aura - a €100M+ revenue powerhouse whose clients include Porsche, Samsung, and Adidas! This strategic partnership positions us to grow quickly in a relatively untapped market. Now we’re looking for a talented engineer to join our team and help propel our success!
 



  





**🌟 Why Join Us?** 




  





 Imagine a world where every piece of business information automatically finds its way to the right person, at the right time, in exactly the right format. That's what we're building - an AI-powered workspace that transforms how businesses handle information and generate insights. 
 



  





 Our platform is already catching attention: we're fresh out of our proof-of-concept phase, have secured development funding from our consulting partner, and are positioned to tap into their enterprise client network. Now we're ready to scale our platform to the next level!
 



  





**🧠 Our Philosophy & Story** 




  





 We're not your typical tech startup. Our technical co-founder learned to code using GPT as a pair programmer in 2022, and has since built full-stack applications for businesses worldwide. This unconventional journey gives an idea into how we work and think about growth.
 



  





 We believe great software comes from creative problem-solving and innovative approaches, not just following traditional playbooks. We've proven that with the right tools, mindset, and determination, we can build powerful solutions that compete with teams 10x our size.
 



  





 What does this mean for you? We're looking for a builder - someone who thrives on finding creative solutions and isn't afraid to challenge conventional wisdom. We don't want someone who needs step-by-step instructions; we want someone who can take a problem, run with it, and surprise us with innovative solutions.
 



  





 Our approach to quality is uncompromising, but our path to getting there is flexible. We believe in:
 



  





 - 🛠️ Using every tool at our disposal (including AI) to build better software
 



 - 🎯 Focusing on outcomes rather than following rigid processes
 



 - 🔄 Rapid iteration and learning from real-world feedback
 



 - 🎨 Finding creative solutions to complex problems
 



 - 🤝 Building features that actually solve user problems
 



  





**🎯 The Opportunity** 




  





 We're looking for a talented Senior Full-Stack Engineer to join our founding team and help shape our platform's future. You'll be our first technical hire, working directly with our technical founder and soon mentoring other team members to turn our MVP into a robust, enterprise-grade solution. If you're excited about AI, love solving complex problems, and want to be part of something big from the ground up - we want to talk to you!
 



  





**✨ What You'll Do** 




  





 - 🏗️ Co-lead the technical evolution of our AI-powered platform
 



 - 🔧 Help shape our architecture and technical decisions
 



 - 💡 Bring innovative features from concept to production
 



 - 🤝 Collaborate directly with founders and future team members
 



 - 📈 Help scale our platform as we grow with our enterprise clients
 



  





**🛠️ Our Current Tech Stack** 




  





 - Next.js & TypeScript
 



 - React (because we believe in component-based architecture)
 



 - Supabase (our reliable data backbone)
 



 - Various AI services (the magic behind our platform)
 



  





**👀 What We're Looking For** 




  





 - 3-5+ years of full-stack engineering/development experience
 



 - Strong TypeScript and React expertise
 



 - Experience integrating AI/ML services
 



 - Background in B2B SaaS products
 



 - Knowledge of enterprise security practices
 



 - Experience with Next.js and modern React patterns
 



 - A knack for building scalable applications
 



 - Located within CET ±2 hours (preferred - we believe in reasonable async collaboration!)
 



  





**🎉 What Makes You Stand Out** 




  





 - Startup experience 
 



 - Knowledge of Supabase/PostgreSQL
 



 - You use AI in your current workflow as much as possible
 



  





**🎁 What We Offer** 




  





 - 💰 Competitive contract rate, with opportunity for full-time employment and additional benefits as we grow. Note that this range is a good faith estimate; actual compensation may differ based on skill and experience level.
 



 - 🏠 Flexible full remote work setup
 



 - 📈 Potential equity participation
 



 - 🌴 Unlimited PTO, with
 *minimum time off* 
 to make sure you are rested and at your best
 



 - 🎮 Direct impact on product decisions
 



 - 🚀 Ground-floor opportunity in a fast-growing startup
 



 - 🤝 Close collaboration with founding team
 



 - 📚 Budget for learning and development
 



 - 💼 Potential for conversion to full-time employment based on company growth and performance
 



  





**🎯 Our Values** 




  





 - 🔍 We obsess over user experience
 



 - 🧪 We experiment and learn fast
 



 - 🤝 We believe in open communication
 



 - ⚡ We move quickly but thoughtfully
 



 - 🎭 We maintain work-life harmony
 



  





  🎪 Interview Process
 



  





 No endless loops here. We move fast and we’ll keep it focused and meaningful:
 



  





 1. Initial chat with our technical founder
 



 2. Technical deep-dive (real-world problems, not algorithm puzzles!)
 



 3. Team fit conversation
 



 4. Final discussion and offer
 



  





**🚗 Next Steps** 




  





 Ready to help us revolutionize how businesses handle information? Send us:
 



 1. Your experience with similar tech stacks
 



 2. What excites you about our mission
 



 3. Your timezone and preferred working hours
 



 4. Some things you’ve built and/or a project you're proud of (could be anything, not just code!)
 



 5. When you could start
 



  





 Email us at careers@synca.ai - We'd love to chat!
 



  





**💪 Impact Potential** 




  





 By joining us now, you'll:
 



 - Shape our technical foundation
 



 - Build features used by enterprise clients
 



 - Work with cutting-edge AI technology
 



 - Help grow our development team
 



 - Be part of an exciting journey from MVP to scale
 



  





 P.S. This isn't just another startup - by joining now, you'll be instrumental in building an AI platform that will transform how some of the world's largest businesses handle information. We're at that perfect sweet spot: proven concept, secured funding, and enterprise-level opportunities, but still early enough for you to make a massive impact! 🚀

title: Systemutvecklare Java
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Technology, Information and Media
description:
Om rollen
   

  

 Vill du utvecklas i en miljö där innovation, gemenskap och samhällsnytta står i fokus? Hos Sopra Steria får du arbeta med digitala lösningar som verkligen gör skillnad – tillsammans med drivna kollegor i ett företag som prisats som
 *Sveriges bästa arbetsplats* 
 av Great Place to Work. Vi söker nu fler Javautvecklare till våra agila team i Stockholm!
   

  

 Som Javautvecklare hos oss blir du en del av våra agila teamleveranser, där du arbetar nära både kollegor och kunder för att utveckla lösningar som bidrar till samhällsnytta och teknisk innovation. Våra projekt är ofta långsiktiga och inkluderar tekniklyft hos kunder inom exempelvis offentlig sektor.
   

  

 I rollen får du jobba med modern teknik som Java, Spring Boot, Kubernetes och ramverk som Angular, React eller Vue. Vi har en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning och gemenskap, där du blir en viktig del av vårt utvecklarcommunity. Läs mer här!
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har minst 5 års erfarenhet av Java-utveckling.
* Är nyfiken på nya tekniker och värdesätter kunskapsdelning.
* Trivs med att samarbeta nära kunder och kollegor.
* Behärskar svenska och engelska flytande i tal och skrift.


**Varför Sopra Steria?**
* En arbetsplats som förenar trygghet och flexibilitet.
* Prisbelönt företagskultur med fokus på gemenskap och personlig utveckling.
* Spännande projekt som gör skillnad i samhället.
* Ett starkt team där du utvecklas tillsammans med kompetenta och hjälpsamma kollegor.


**Ansökan**
 Låter det som något för dig? Skicka in ditt CV redan idag! Ansök enkelt via vår hemsida. Har du frågor om tjänsten? Kontakta vår rekryterare Hanna Korell på
 **[email protected]** 
 .
   

  

 Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

 Ytterligare information
   

  

 Sopra Steria är ett ledande internationellt konsultbolag inom digital transformation. Vi bygger samhället genom designdriven innovation, teknisk utveckling med kunskap om marknadens ledande plattformar och driftlösningar (managed services). Med modern teknologi och en gedigen affärsförståelse är vi en helhetspartner för våra kunder och deras digitala transformationsresa. Enligt Great Place To Work är vi en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser, vi har tilldelats utmärkelsen Karriärföretag flera år i rad och Gartner har listat oss som ett topp 5 bolag inom digital transformation.

title: Senior Android Developer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Ready to shape the future of entertainment for millions of users? I’m Joakim Svensson, and I am seeking a Senior Android Developer to join our Telia Play team. With your skills in Android development, you’ll lead innovation for our TV and video streaming services across the Nordics.
   

  

**As a Senior Android Developer, you’ll...**
 You’ll play a key role in enhancing and maintaining Telia Play, our TV and video streaming service used by over 1.5 million customers. You’ll design, develop, and optimize Android applications focusing on performance, scalability, and great user experiences. Working within a cross-functional team, you’ll collaborate with designers and backend developers to implement modern architectural patterns and coding standards. With access to the latest tools and frameworks like Kotlin, Compose, and GraphQL, you’ll mentor junior developers and help shape the future of our platform. This role is perfect for someone passionate about delivering exceptional digital solutions that impact users’ lives every day.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For**
 We’re seeking a seasoned Android developer with significant expertise in building scalable, high-quality applications for Android and Android TV platforms. You’ll have strong proficiency in Kotlin, Java, and Compose, with a proven ability to design and implement advanced architectural patterns. Experience with Leanback for Android TV, GraphQL client libraries like Apollo, and performance optimization techniques is essential. You should have a deep understanding of adaptive streaming protocols like DASH and HLS, as well as knowledge of video streaming and playback technologies. Proficiency in managing Git workflows, ensuring code quality, and maintaining high test coverage is critical. Strong problem-solving skills, a collaborative mindset, and a passion for mentoring others round out the profile of the ideal candidate. Bonus if you have experience with TV-specific hardware features such as remote controls, voice interaction, and Android accessibility tools like TalkBack.
   

  

**Why Telia:**
 We are more than a workplace. Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we’re passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability.
   

  

 We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you’ll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You’ll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We´re looking forward to your application by 20.02.2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed.
   

  

 Got questions? Please reach out to Joakim Svensson at joakim.svensson@teliacompany.com
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
Would you like to play a key part in Toca Boca’s Data and Insights Team? With over 60 million monthly active users and terabytes of daily data, in the role of a Senior Analytics Engineer you will play an integral role in understanding and developing our analytics infrastructure that handles petabyte scale data for both Toca and our owners Spin Master.
   

  

 Our team is a unique blend of data insights functions, namely data science, data engineering, business intelligence as well as analytics engineering.
   

  

**What You’ll Be Doing**
 As a Senior Analytics Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, developing, and optimising dbt models that transform raw data into actionable insights. By leveraging your expertise in dbt and BigQuery, you will help ensure our data pipelines are scalable, efficient, and cost-effective. Collaborating closely with data engineers and data scientists, you’ll facilitate the creation of reliable, well-structured data models that support advanced analytics and decision-making across the organisation.
   

  

 You’ll work hand-in-hand with data scientists and analysts to understand their needs, ensuring the availability of clean and optimized data for analysis, modeling, and experimentation. Together with the data engineering team, you’ll integrate new data sources, optimize materialization strategies, and fine-tune performance to handle large-scale workloads seamlessly. Your role will also involve promoting best practices in data modeling and fostering a culture of collaboration between analytics and engineering teams.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Is this you?**
 You are an experienced data professional with a strong track record in dbt model development, including modular code, testing, and documentation. You have expertise in designing scalable materialization strategies, identifying performance bottlenecks, and optimizing queries for cost-efficiency in BigQuery.
   

  

 You are comfortable working closely with cross-functional teams, from data engineers to data scientists, to align technical efforts with analytical goals. You have strong stakeholder management skills, excelling at translating requirements into effective data solutions while balancing performance, cost, and usability. Additionally, you have a passion for driving technical excellence, sharing knowledge, and fostering a collaborative work environment.
   

  

 You are a team player who is good at unblocking the team and driving a high standard for quality and ease of improvement.
   

  

 You believe in the power of play!
   

  

**This is us!**
 Toca Boca captures the spirit of play and is key within the Digital Games group within Spin Master. We create digital toys and everyday products that are filled with fun and silliness that kids from any corner of the world can instantly relate to. Everything is designed from their perspective .
   

  

 The Spin Master Mission and Vision is to make life more fun by pushing the boundaries of innovation, creativity, and fun!.
   

  

**Good to know!**
 This position is full time and based in our Stockholm studio with a hybrid working model (part office, part working from home). We apply a 6-month probationary period. You’ll need to be located in Sweden as we are unable to support relocation. As we’re an international company, with over 20 nationalities working here, and millions of users all over the world, you need to be fluent in English. Your application should therefore be in English.
